intro: Nasa anderssonii, commonly known as the Andes nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinct, somewhat toxic scent. Nasa anderssonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of the Andean mountains.
